message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.HC 

This paper deals with human activity recognition from video streams, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a novel framework that uses deep learning models (specifically, Bidirectional Long Short Term Memory) for activity recognition, which falls under machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses algorithmic techniques for training the deep network with limited labeled data, which is a common challenge in computer vision and machine learning. Additionally, the paper evaluates the proposed framework using metrics such as accuracy, which is a common practice in multimedia (cs.MM) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC) research.
